intro: Tragia balfourii, commonly known as the hairy tragia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive, rough texture. Tragia balfourii is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of semi-arid ecosystems.
